message_1: In a message encrypted with Caesar cipher, the letter "A" is transformed into "D", the letter "B" is transformed into "E", and so on. If the encrypted message "GCUA VQ DTGCM" is decrypted using Caesar cipher, what is the original message?
message_2:
To decrypt the message, we need to reverse the Caesar cipher by shifting the letters back by the same amount they were shifted forward. In this case, the shift is 3 letters (A -> D, B -> E, etc.).

So, we will shift each letter in the encrypted message "GCUA VQ DTGCM" back by 3 positions:

G -> D
C -> Z
U -> R
A -> X

V -> S
Q -> N

D -> A
T -> Q
G -> D
C -> Z
M -> J

The decrypted message is "DZRX SN AQDZJ".
